title: What champions really do after the Nexus explodes

replies.body:
Something something there's a hentai comic about this something something.

Wait no that's about what champions do when the servers go down.

My favorite combo is flash + dash combo into enemy fountain + dance.

I've won every game I've done it in.

> [{quoted}](name=AbsorbantTNT,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=wYevwkNq,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-10-28T04:15:51.228+0000)
> ~~I've won every game I've done it in.~~ ---->>> I haven't lost any game I've done it in.

You mean you haven't yet escaped a crumbling team base, made it all the way to the other side of the map through several enemy towers not destroyed because your teammates are scrubs, and then flash-danced into the enemy summoner platform in perfect timing with loss because you somehow can keep up with your nexus's health bar from all the way across the map?

Noob.

P.S. I think people are about to redefine "flash mob" on League.
Also true for _when the servers go down_.

>Also true for _when the servers go down._

That about the truth of it.

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/a36e5c1f0290c2e785ddbf89b1a1ee1e.jpg

For over a decade I spent using internet and playing online games...
League of Legends is the only game that can reset my router or even shut down my internet connection.

I even had a period when I was preemptively resetting my router every one or two games, for it to not die on me durning a game.
Like I could use internet whole day at 100% capacity and nothing ever would happen, but the moment I started a LoL game, it'd die within 15 minutes.

Like before I installed LoL, there were only 3 reasons that'd cause problems with my internet connection:
- unplugging the cable
- lightning bolt striking directly or near telephone network or power lines
- maintenance by my ISP

Unless they're on the losing team
http://i.imgur.com/0KhLn1V.gif?noredirect
